snippet: What British officials call Prince William’s routine mission is stirring interest at home and abroad as the 30th anniversary of Argentina’s invasion of the Falkland Islands approaches.
abstract: British authorities say that their deployment of Prince William on a flight training mission in the Falkland Islands has nothing to do with the impending 30th anniversary of the Falkland War, a 1982 conflict between Argentina and Great Britain; posting is widely seen as an intentional provocation in Argentina, where British rule of the Falklands is still considered an unjust colonial holdover; dispute over the Islands has intensified in recent years, following discovery of oil and deployment of additional British troops.
lead_paragraph: What British officials call Prince William’s routine mission is stirring interest at home and abroad as the 30th anniversary of Argentina’s invasion of the Falkland Islands approaches.

headline.seo: Prince William’s Posting to Falklands Revives Ire
headline.main: Prince’s Posting in Falklands Revives Ire Before Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Prince’s Posting in Falklands Revives Ire Before Anniversary
